instructions: ✅ Select the correct option (A, B, C, or D).
✅ Each question has only ONE correct answer.
✅ Focus on variable declaration, initialization, scope, and data types.
✅ Try without seeing answers first, then verify.

questions.question: What is a variable in Java?

options.A: A fixed value that cannot change
options.B: A container used to store data values
options.C: A Java keyword used for loops

questions.details: A variable is a memory location that stores a value which can change during program execution.

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct syntax to declare an integer variable?
questions.details: In Java, variable declaration format is: dataType variableName;

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct way to declare and initialize a variable?
questions.details: Declaration + initialization example: int a = 10;

questions.question: What will be the default value of an instance variable of type int in Java?
questions.details: Instance variables in Java are automatically initialized; int default value is 0.

questions.question: What will be the default value of an instance variable of type boolean?
questions.details: Default value of boolean instance variable is false.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a valid variable name in Java?
questions.details: Variable names cannot start with a digit in Java.

questions.question: Which symbol is used to assign a value to a variable?
questions.details: In Java, '=' is assignment operator, while '==' is comparison operator.

questions.question: Which one is a valid declaration of a char variable?
questions.details: char stores a single character inside single quotes.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to declare a constant variable in Java?
questions.details: final keyword makes a variable constant (cannot be reassigned).

questions.question: Which of these variables is a local variable?

options.B: Variable declared inside a class but outside methods

questions.details: Local variables are declared inside methods/blocks and must be initialized before use.

questions.question: Which variable is shared among all objects of a class?
questions.details: Static variables belong to class, not to individual objects.

questions.question: Which of the following is an instance variable?

options.B: Declared inside a class but outside a method

questions.details: Instance variables are declared inside class but outside method.

questions.question: What is the scope of a local variable?

options.C: Only within the block/method where declared

questions.details: Local variables are accessible only within the method/block.

questions.question: Which of the following can store decimal values?
questions.details: double and float are used for decimal values.

questions.question: Which is the correct statement about Java variables?

options.A: Local variables have default values automatically
options.B: Instance variables must be initialized manually always
options.C: Local variables must be initialized before use

questions.details: Local variables do NOT get default values; must be initialized before usage.
Local variable 'a' is not initialized, so compiler throws error.

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid boolean variable initialization?
questions.details: boolean can store only true or false.

questions.question: Which datatype is used to store a single character?
questions.details: char stores a single 16-bit Unicode character.

questions.question: Which datatype is best for storing large integer values?
questions.details: long is used for large integers (64-bit).

questions.question: What is the size of int in Java?
questions.details: int is 32-bit signed in Java.

questions.question: What is the size of char in Java?
questions.details: char is 16-bit (Unicode).

questions.question: Which is the correct way to declare multiple variables in one line?
questions.details: You can declare multiple variables with commas.

questions.question: Which of the following is correct for float variable initialization?
questions.details: Float literals need suffix 'f' (or 'F') in Java.

questions.question: Which statement is true about static variables?

options.A: They are created separately for every object
options.B: They are shared among all objects

questions.details: Static variables belong to the class, shared among all objects.

questions.question: Which of these is a correct String declaration?
questions.details: String uses double quotes and 'String' is capital S.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to refer to current object instance variables?
questions.details: this refers to the current object.

questions.question: What is type casting in Java?

options.A: Converting one datatype into another datatype

questions.details: Type casting converts a value from one type to another.

questions.question: Which casting is done automatically by Java?
questions.details: Widening casting (small → large) happens automatically.

questions.question: Which one is narrowing casting?
questions.details: double → int loses data, so it's narrowing and needs explicit cast.

questions.question: Which statement correctly declares a long variable?
questions.details: Using 'L' suffix is recommended for long literals.
